name: GlobalStatus
description: The GlobalStatus is a complex component meant for displaying global Application notifications or a summary of a form.

props.name: text
props.doc: The text appears as the status content. Besides plain text, you can send in a React component as well. Defaults to `null`.

props.name: status_id
props.doc: Define a new stack ID so you can remove it with the same ID later on. Defaults to `null`.

props.name: status_anchor_url
props.doc: Use `status_anchor_url={true}` to enable the go-to link, defined as a url hash using the `status_id`. Or provide it with an actual url: `status_anchor_url="https://"`.

props.name: status_anchor_text
props.doc: Defines the anchor text showing up after every item, in case there is a `status_id` defined. Defaults to `GÃ¥ til %s`. The `%s` represents the optional and internal handled label addition.

props.name: status_anchor_label
props.doc: Adds an additional text to the anchor (replaces `%s`), showing up after every item. Is used by default by other form components, if they have an `label`.

props.name: id
props.doc: The main ID. Defaults to `main`.

props.name: message
props.doc: The text appears as the status content. Besides plain text, you can send in a React component as well. Defaults to `null`.

props.name: remove_on_unmount
props.doc: Set to `true` if you want that the component `<GlobalStatus.Add remove_on_unmount={true} ... />` should automatically remove the stacked status from the target **GlobalStatus** on component unmount. Defaults to `false`.

props.name: title
props.doc: The title appears as a part of the status content. Defaults to `En feil har skjedd`.

props.name: children
props.doc: The text appears as the status content. Besides plain text, you can send in a React component as well. Defaults to `null`.

props.name: items
props.doc: The items (list items) appear as a part of the status content. you can both use an JSON array, or a vanilla array with a string or an object content. See **Item Object** example below.

props.name: icon
props.doc: The icon shown before the status title. Defaults to `exclamation`.

props.name: state
props.doc: Defines the visual appearance of the status. There are four main statuses `error`, `warning`, `info` and `success`. The default status is `error`.

props.name: icon_size
props.doc: The icon size of the title icon shows. Defaults to `medium`.

props.name: show
props.doc: Set to `true` or `false` to manually make the global status visible. Defaults to `true`.

props.name: autoclose
props.doc: Set to `true` to automatically close the global status if there are no more left items in the provider stack. Defaults to `true`.

props.name: autoscroll
props.doc: Set to `true` to automatically scroll the page to the appeared global status. Defaults to `true`.

props.name: no_animation
props.doc: Set to `true` to disable the show/hide/slide/fade/grow/shrink animation. Defaults to `false`.

props.name: delay
props.doc: Defines the delay on how long the automated visibility should wait before it appears to the user. Defaults to `200ms`.

props.name: hide_close_button
props.doc: Set to `true` if the close button should be hidden for the user. Defaults to `false`.

props.name: close_text
props.doc: Text of the close button. Defaults to `Lukk`.

props.name: omit_set_focus
props.doc: Set to `true` to omit setting the focus during visibility. Defaults to `false`. Additionally, there is `omit_set_focus_on_update` which is set to `true` by default.

props.name: omit_set_focus_on_update
props.doc: Set to `true` to omit setting the focus during update. Defaults to `true`.

props.name: skeleton
props.doc: If set to `true`, an overlaying skeleton with animation will be shown.

events.name: on_open
events.doc: Gets triggered the first time the GlobalStatus appears on the screen. In other words, it has to have been hidden before. Returns `{ id, status_id, ...properties }`.

events.name: on_show
events.doc: Gets triggered for the first time and for every new content update the GlobalStatus gets. Returns `{ id, status_id, ...properties }`.

events.name: on_close
events.doc: Gets triggered once the GlobalStatus disappears from the screen. Works only if `no_animation` is not `true`. Returns `{ id, status_id, ...properties }`.

events.name: on_hide
events.doc: Gets triggered once the GlobalStatus is getting closed/hidden by the user. Returns `{ id, status_id, ...properties }`.

events.name: on_adjust
events.doc: Gets triggered once the GlobalStatus is getting new content by the user. Returns `{ id, status_id, ...properties }`.
